title: West warns Putin against ‘dangerous’ nuclear rhetoric but downplays threat
description: U.S. and NATO officials said there was no indication Russia changed its nuclear posture after President Vladimir Putin said he planned to store tactical nuclear weapons in Belarus.

title: Tunisia says dozens killed as three ships sink in Mediterranean
description: The Tunisian Coast Guard said Sunday that 29 people were dead after three boats crossing the Mediterranean Sea to Italy capsized along the Tunisian coast.

title: Police using ‘excessive force’ at France protests, rights groups say
description: Police are under fire for their heavy-handed response to protests against plans to raise France's retirement age.

title: Netanyahu fires defense minister who called for halt to judicial overhaul
description: Defense Minister Yoav Gallant publicly said on Saturday night that plans to overhaul Israel's judiciary were a threat to the country's security.

title: Eyes on abstention as Cubans vote for National Assembly
description: Cubans are voting in National Assembly elections with attention focused on voter turnout amid a deep economic and migratory crisis

title: Florida school uproar leads Italy to invite viewing 'David'
description: A Florence museum and the city’s mayor are inviting parents and students from a Florida charter school to visit and see Michelangelo’s “David.”

title: Pray for rain: Spanish farmers hold unique Mass amid drought
description: In drought-stricken Spain, around 250 villagers brought back the faded practice of a special Mass and procession to pray for rain

title: Monarch butterflies lose sanctuary in Mexico as climate changes
description: The population of endangered monarch butterflies wintering in Mexico's Michoacan dropped by 22% in just one year.

title: Pakistani ex-PM Khan sets out economic rescue plan at rally
description: Former Pakistani Prime Minister Imran Khan says the government has no plan to bring the country out of crisis

title: Group says Libyan coast guard fired shots over rescue ship
description: A sea rescue group says Libya’s coast guard fired warning shots over a humanitarian vessel as it attempted to rescue a rubber boat carrying migrants off Libya’s coast

title: Daylight savings dispute leaves Lebanon with two time zones
description: The Lebanese government’s last-minute decision to delay the start of daylight savings time by a month until the end of the Muslim holy month of Ramadan resulted in mass confusion

title: Israeli FM: UAE pardons Israeli citizen after drug sentence
description: Israeli officials say the United Arab Emirates has pardoned an Israeli woman after initially sentencing her to death for drug possession

title: Ukraine live briefing: U.S. says nuclear posture unchanged as Russia moves nuclear-capable planes to Belarus
description: Russian President Vladimir Putin said Moscow had moved 10 nuclear-capable warplanes to Belarus, which shares a border with northern Ukraine.

title: Netanyahu’s political touch eludes him as Israel spirals into chaos
description: Little about his government’s sudden push to remake the courts, or its response to the international backlash, bears the hallmark of a Netanyahu production.

title: Taiwan breaks ties with Honduras after it switches allegiance to Beijing
description: China has mounted a global pressure campaign to poach the remaining countries that recognize Taiwan.

title: Kyiv doctor killed in Russian airstrike shows war’s fallout far from front
description: Oksana Leontieva, a pediatric hematologist and single mother, was driving to work when a Russian airstrike hit the center of the Ukrainian capital.
